intro: Cruciata glabra, commonly known as the smooth cruciata, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing vines and trifoliate leaves with smooth margins. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruit is a spherical, green berry that turns orange when ripe, containing several seeds. Cruciata glabra is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
